docs.text: That's WHY I write this website Build up a blogs for self is one special thing for coders. It's tranditional as well as fashionable. I'd like to write down what I am learning and organise what I've learnt in the world of computer science. I am a junior student now, and it's always not too late to do such meaningful work.

docs.title: 1 Algorithm I - Princeton University

docs.text: Algorithm Syllabus An introduction to fundamental data types, algorithms, and data structures. Our emphasis is on applications and scientific performance analysis of Java implementations. - Part I focuses on elementary data structures, sorting, and searching. Topics include union−find, binary search, stacks, queues, bags, insertion sort, selection sort, shellsort, quicksort, 3-way quicksort, mergesort, heapsort, binary heaps, binary search trees, red−black trees, separate-chaining and linear-probing hash tables, Graham scan, and kd-trees. Part II focuses on graph and string-processing algorithms. Topics include depth-first search, breadth-first search, topological sort, Kosaraju−Sharir, Kruskal, Prim, Dijkistra, Bellman−Ford, Ford−Fulkerson, LSD radix sort, MSD radix sort, 3-way radix quicksort, multiway tries, ternary search tries, Knuth−Morris−Pratt, Boyer−Moore, Rabin–Karp, regular expression matching, run-length coding, Huffman coding, LZW compression and Burrows−Wheeler transform. Part II also introduces reductions and intractability, including the P = NP problem. Ideas Algorithm: method for solving a problem. Data structure: method to store information. “ Algorithms + Data Structures = Programs. ” — Niklaus Wirth
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: An introduction to fundamental data types, algorithms, and data structures. Our emphasis is on applications and scientific performance analysis of Java implementations. - Part I focuses on elementary data structures, sorting, and searching. Topics include union−find, binary search, stacks, queues, bags, insertion sort, selection sort, shellsort, quicksort, 3-way quicksort, mergesort, heapsort, binary heaps, binary search trees, red−black trees, separate-chaining and linear-probing hash tables, Graham scan, and kd-trees. Part II focuses on graph and string-processing algorithms. Topics include depth-first search, breadth-first search, topological sort, Kosaraju−Sharir, Kruskal, Prim, Dijkistra, Bellman−Ford, Ford−Fulkerson, LSD radix sort, MSD radix sort, 3-way radix quicksort, multiway tries, ternary search tries, Knuth−Morris−Pratt, Boyer−Moore, Rabin–Karp, regular expression matching, run-length coding, Huffman coding, LZW compression and Burrows−Wheeler transform. Part II also introduces reductions and intractability, including the P = NP problem.
docs.title: Syllabus

docs.text: Algorithm: method for solving a problem. Data structure: method to store information. “ Algorithms + Data Structures = Programs. ” — Niklaus Wirth
docs.title: Ideas

docs.text: Algorithm Class Note Steps to developing a usable algorithm. - Model the problem. - Find an algorithm to solve it. - Fast enough? Fits in memory? - If not, figure out why. - Find a way to address the problem. - Iterate until satisfied 1.5 Union Find Problem Given a set of N objects. - Union command: connect tow objects - Find/connected query: is there a oath connecting the tow objects? Model Mapping the objects 0 to N-1 Use integers as array index. Suppress details not relevant to union-find Assume "is connected to" is an equivalence relation: the relation of connected satisfies is Reflecive, Symmetric and Transitive. Connected components. Maximal set of objects that are mutually connected. public class UF UF(int N) //initialize union-find data structure with N objects (0 to N – 1) void union(int p, int q) //add connection between p and q boolean connected(int p, int q) // are p and q in the same component? int find(int p) //component identifier for p (0 to N – 1) int count() //number of components Algorithm 1 Quick-find [eager approach] Data structure. Integer array id[] of length N. Interpretation: p and q are connected iff they have the same id. Find. Check if p and q have the same id. Union. To merge components containing p and q, change all entries whose id equals id[p] to id[q]. Implementation Initialize O(n) id[i] = i Union p, q O(n) set all id[i] == id[p] to id[q] IsUnion O(1) Drawbacks Too slow. If these are N union operation, it costs $N^2$ time to run. Quadratic time is much to slow. 2 Quick-union [lazy approach] Data structure. Integer array id[] of length N. Interpretation: id[i] is parent of i. Root of i is id[id[id[...id[i]...]]]: keep going until it doesn’t change(algorithm ensures no cycles) Find O(N) Check if p and q have the same root. Union O(N) To merge components containing p and q, set the id of p's root to the id of q's root. Defect Trees can get tall so that each time we costs O(N) to find root. Improvement 1: weighting Weighted quick-union. Modify quick-union to avoid tall trees. Keep track of size of each tree (number of objects). Balance by linking root of smaller tree to root of larger tree. Implement Maintain a size[] array to record each tree's size Initialize it with size[i] = 1 Consolt and Update size[] when union operation Running time. Find: takes time proportional to depth of p and q. $O(lg(N^+))$ Union: takes constant time, given roots. $O(lg(N^+))$ By limiting the depth of trees, the time of find root reduced from $O(N)$ to $O(lg(N^+))$ Proposition. Depth of any node x is at most $lg N$. Pf. When does depth of x increase? Increases by 1 when tree T1 containing x is merged into another tree T2. The size of the tree containing x at least doubles since $| T 2 | ≥ | T 1 |$. Size of tree containing x can double at most lg N times. For $ N = 2^(lgN)$ Comparision of $N$ and $lgN$ $N$ $lgN$ 1 0 1 thousand 10 1 million 20 1 billion 30 iterate log function $lg^{*} N$ is the number of times the logarithm function must be iteratively applied before the result is less than or equal to 1. Improvement 2: path compressing Impletation Add an extra loop to renew the root. Or set id[i] = id[id[i]]. The last one is simple and good enough in pratice. Even though it may encounter N depth situation. Proposition. [Hopcroft-Ulman, Tarjan] Starting from an empty data structure, any sequence of M union-find ops on N objects makes ≤ $c ( N + M lg^* N )$ array accesses. Amazing fact. [Fredman-Saks] No linear-time algorithm exists. Ex. [$10^9$ unions and finds with $10^9$ objects] WQUPC (Weighted Quick-Union with Path Compression) reduces time from 30 years to 6 seconds. Supercomputer won't help much; good algorithm enables solution. Application Monte Carlo simulation TO find percolation possibility Create virtual sites which presents top and bottom [So smart!] Remain Problem: how to tell the full sites from site? Answer: if the neightbor is full, full it!
docs.title: Union Find

Implement Maintain a size[] array to record each tree's size Initialize it with size[i] = 1 Consolt and Update size[] when union operation Running time. Find: takes time proportional to depth of p and q. $O(lg(N^+))$ Union: takes constant time, given roots. $O(lg(N^+))$ By limiting the depth of trees, the time of find root reduced from $O(N)$ to $O(lg(N^+))$ Proposition. Depth of any node x is at most $lg N$. Pf. When does depth of x increase? Increases by 1 when tree T1 containing x is merged into another tree T2. The size of the tree containing x at least doubles since $| T 2 | ≥ | T 1 |$. Size of tree containing x can double at most lg N times. For $ N = 2^(lgN)$ Comparision of $N$ and $lgN$ $N$ $lgN$ 1 0 1 thousand 10 1 million 20 1 billion 30 iterate log function $lg^{*} N$ is the number of times the logarithm function must be iteratively applied before the result is less than or equal to 1.

[Hopcroft-Ulman, Tarjan] Starting from an empty data structure, any sequence of M union-find ops on N objects makes ≤ $c ( N + M lg^* N )$ array accesses. Amazing fact. [Fredman-Saks] No linear-time algorithm exists. Ex. [$10^9$ unions and finds with $10^9$ objects] WQUPC (Weighted Quick-Union with Path Compression) reduces time from 30 years to 6 seconds. docs.text: Algorithm Class Note 1.4 ANALYSIS OF ALGORITHMS Introduction Scientific method applied to analysis of algorithms Scientific method Observe some feature of the natural world. 观察 Hypothesize a model that is consistent with the observations. 假设 Predict events using the hypothesis. 利用假设预测 Verify the predictions by making further observations. 根据更多的观察验证假设 Validate by repeating until the hypothesis and observations agree. 如此迭代直到假设与观察相一致 Principles. Experiments must be reproducible. 实验可再现 Hypotheses must be falsifiable. 假设可证伪 Observations power law aN^b 幂定律 Data analysis Standard plot. Plot running time T (N) vs. input size N Log-log plot. Plot running time T (N) vs. input size N using log-log scale Do log-log plot to see if the complex is a*N^b (which will turn a straight line) Prediction and validation Doubling hypothesis. Quick way to estimate b in a power-law relationship. Run program, doubling the size of the input How to estimate a in a power-law relationship? Run sufficient large value of N System independent effects. determines exponent b in power law Algorithm. Input data. System dependent effects. determines constant a in power law Hardware: CPU, memory, cache, … Software: compiler, interpreter, garbage collector, … System: operating system, network, other apps, … Mathematical Models
docs.title: Algorithm Class Note

docs.text: Scientific method Observe some feature of the natural world. 观察 Hypothesize a model that is consistent with the observations. 假设 Predict events using the hypothesis. 利用假设预测 Verify the predictions by making further observations. 根据更多的观察验证假设 Validate by repeating until the hypothesis and observations agree. 如此迭代直到假设与观察相一致 Principles. Experiments must be reproducible. 实验可再现 Hypotheses must be falsifiable. 假设可证伪
docs.title: Scientific method applied to analysis of algorithms

docs.text: power law aN^b 幂定律 Data analysis Standard plot. Plot running time T (N) vs. input size N Log-log plot. Plot running time T (N) vs. input size N using log-log scale Do log-log plot to see if the complex is a*N^b (which will turn a straight line) Prediction and validation Doubling hypothesis. Quick way to estimate b in a power-law relationship. Run program, doubling the size of the input How to estimate a in a power-law relationship? Run sufficient large value of N System independent effects. determines exponent b in power law Algorithm. Input data. System dependent effects. determines constant a in power law Hardware: CPU, memory, cache, … Software: compiler, interpreter, garbage collector, … System: operating system, network, other apps, …
docs.title: Observations

docs.text: 剑指OFFER 典型编程题 阅读笔记 Source 作者参考代码 一些总体的指导原则 不修改输入数组 > 修改输入的数组 测试用例 功能测试 边界值测试 特殊输入测试 null 不合法的输入 5 优化时间和空间效率 5.2 时间效率 一些影响时间效率的细节： - C/C++中的引用传值vs值转递，后者从形参到实参会产生一次拷贝操作。 - 循环vs递归，递归更简洁，但时间效率可能更差。实践中，可以用递归思考问题，用数组来保存中间结果，基于循环实现。 - 算法，根据输入数据的特点采用最合适的算法。 - 面试时，可以在第一时间告诉面试官最直观的算法，然后一步步优化，逼近最优算法，展现态度和激情。 P25：数组中出现次数超过一半的数字 要点： - 时间复杂度的考虑：排序后搜索vs统计数字出现次数 - 全面性：给定的输入非法，如空指针、数组长度为1、不存在次数超过一半的数字 - 应该写代码检查，并规定非法情况的返回值 - 得到数组中任意第k大的数字的通用算法 - 基于快速排序的partition函数实现，当选中下标为k时，该数即为第k大的数 - O(n) P41：数据流中的中位数 C++/STL/Vector/Heap [ ] code it P42：连续子数组和的最大值 我有解法3: 采用前缀和分析连续子数组和 思路：如果给出数组的前缀和数组 prefixSum ，则连续子数组 [i, j) 的和为 prefixSum[j] = prefixSum[i] 。要求连续子数组和的最大值，则是在保证 i < j 的情况下，最小化 prefixSum[i] ，最大化 prefixSum[j] 。 实现：O(n)扫描数组，维护变量 minPrefixSum 、 currentSum 、 maxSubArraySum int FindGreatestSumOfSubArray(vector<int>& nums) { if (nums.length == 0) return 0; int minPrefixSum = 0, currentSum = 0, maxSubArraySum = 0x80000000; // in case all inputs are minus for (vector<int>::iterator i = nums.begin(); i != nums.end(); ++i) { currentSum += *i; if (currentSum < minPrefixSum) minPrefixSum = currentSum; if (currentSum - minPrefixSum > maxSubArraySum) maxSubArraySum = currentSum - minPrefixSum; } return maxSubArraySum; } P43： 1~n整数中1出现的次数 题目：给定n，求1~n整数中1出现的次数 思路： 暴力循环，O(nlogn) 递归，每次减少1位最高位，O(logn) 心得： 在问题高度重复的情况下，要善用找规律和递归分析问题 本题的巧妙之处在于，问题的解只和数位上的数字有关，和数字大小无关，由此以数位为拆解单位，用数位来划分递归层次，达到了化简问题的目的 ？？？疑惑： numOtherDigits怎么算出来的？ P44：数字序列中某一位的数字
docs.title: 剑指OFFER 典型编程题 阅读笔记

docs.text: 一些影响时间效率的细节： - C/C++中的引用传值vs值转递，后者从形参到实参会产生一次拷贝操作。 - 循环vs递归，递归更简洁，但时间效率可能更差。实践中，可以用递归思考问题，用数组来保存中间结果，基于循环实现。 - 算法，根据输入数据的特点采用最合适的算法。 - 面试时，可以在第一时间告诉面试官最直观的算法，然后一步步优化，逼近最优算法，展现态度和激情。
docs.title: 5.2 时间效率

docs.text: 要点： - 时间复杂度的考虑：排序后搜索vs统计数字出现次数 - 全面性：给定的输入非法，如空指针、数组长度为1、不存在次数超过一半的数字 - 应该写代码检查，并规定非法情况的返回值 - 得到数组中任意第k大的数字的通用算法 - 基于快速排序的partition函数实现，当选中下标为k时，该数即为第k大的数 - O(n)

docs.text: 我有解法3: 采用前缀和分析连续子数组和 思路：如果给出数组的前缀和数组 prefixSum ，则连续子数组 [i, j) 的和为 prefixSum[j] = prefixSum[i] 。要求连续子数组和的最大值，则是在保证 i < j 的情况下，最小化 prefixSum[i] ，最大化 prefixSum[j] 。 实现：O(n)扫描数组，维护变量 minPrefixSum 、 currentSum 、 maxSubArraySum int FindGreatestSumOfSubArray(vector<int>& nums) { if (nums.length == 0) return 0; int minPrefixSum = 0, currentSum = 0, maxSubArraySum = 0x80000000; // in case all inputs are minus for (vector<int>::iterator i = nums.begin(); i != nums.end(); ++i) { currentSum += *i; if (currentSum < minPrefixSum) minPrefixSum = currentSum; if (currentSum - minPrefixSum > maxSubArraySum) maxSubArraySum = currentSum - minPrefixSum; } return maxSubArraySum; }
docs.title: P42：连续子数组和的最大值

docs.text: 题目：给定n，求1~n整数中1出现的次数 思路： 暴力循环，O(nlogn) 递归，每次减少1位最高位，O(logn) 心得： 在问题高度重复的情况下，要善用找规律和递归分析问题 本题的巧妙之处在于，问题的解只和数位上的数字有关，和数字大小无关，由此以数位为拆解单位，用数位来划分递归层次，达到了化简问题的目的 ？？？疑惑： numOtherDigits怎么算出来的？
docs.title: P43： 1~n整数中1出现的次数
P44：数字序列中某一位的数字

docs.text: 图解密码学阅读笔记 第一部分： 密码 第一章 环游密码世界 术语表 English Chinese sender 发送者 reviever 接收者 eavesdropper 窃听者 encrypt 加密 decrypt 解密 plaintext 明文 cipgertext 秘文 cryptography -- confidentiality -- cryptanalysis -- cryptanalyst -- key 密钥 symmetric cryptography 对称密码，加密和解密时使用同一密钥 public-key cryptography/ asymmetric cryptography 公钥密码/非对称密码，加密和解密时使用不同密钥 hybrid cryptosystem one-way hash function 单向散列函数，验证完整性 integrity 完整性 message authoentication code authentication spoofing 伪装 repudiation 否认 digital signature 数字签名 verify Pseudo Random Number Generator, PRNG 伪随机数生成器 Casesar cipher 凯撒密码 brute-force attack 暴力破解 exhaustive search 穷举 密码学家的工具箱： - 对称密码：机密性（窃听） - 公钥密码：机密性 - 单向散列函数：完整性（篡改） - 消息认证码：完整性，认证（伪装） - 数字签名：完整性，认证，不可否认性（否认） 区别隐写术和密码： - 隐写术：隐藏消息本身 - 密码：隐藏内容 密码与信息安全常识： - 不要使用保密的密码算法 - 使用低强度的密码比不进行加密更危险，这使得使用者麻痹大意 - 密码总有一天会被破解 - 密码只是信息安全的一部分 第二章 历史上的密码 凯撒密码 加密方式：新字母 = 字母在字母表中平移 k 个位置后的字母。 k 为密钥。 可以采用暴力破解 暴力破解代码 简单替换密码 Mapping：将原字母表映射到自身，产生新的字母表。 可能性为 26! 种，暴力难以在短时间内找到解密表 可以用频率分析来破译密码 Enigma 密码算法vs密钥 第三章 对称密码（共享密钥密码） DES 实现：Festel网络 原理：利用 xor 的性质 三重DES 第四章 分组密码的模式 分组密码：只能加密固定长度的明文。要用分组密码加密任意长度的明文，需要对分组密码进行迭代。 分组密码的模式：分组密码的迭代方式。
docs.title: 图解密码学阅读笔记

第二章 历史上的密码

docs.text: 加密方式：新字母 = 字母在字母表中平移 k 个位置后的字母。 k 为密钥。 可以采用暴力破解 暴力破解代码
docs.title: 凯撒密码

docs.text: Mapping：将原字母表映射到自身，产生新的字母表。 可能性为 26! 种，暴力难以在短时间内找到解密表 可以用频率分析来破译密码
docs.title: 简单替换密码
第三章 对称密码（共享密钥密码）

docs.text: 实现：Festel网络 原理：利用 xor 的性质
docs.title: DES

docs.text: 分组密码：只能加密固定长度的明文。要用分组密码加密任意长度的明文，需要对分组密码进行迭代。 分组密码的模式：分组密码的迭代方式。
docs.title: 第四章 分组密码的模式

docs.text: date: 2023.01.01 author: Yilin *应新的要求，把有关其的所有内容撤出网站 2023 New Year Wishes Qi：不要后悔。不知道想要的人生是怎么样的，也不知道各种各样的可能性自己喜欢哪一种。目前觉得好像什么都无所谓。 Xin：知道自己未来生活的轮廓。跟琳在一起。让自己安心地活下去——消除生活中的种种隐患（没有语言成绩）、修好各种基础设施（如博客）、自由自在地生活，不想再被限制自由。 Lin：在有动力-遇到困难-放弃-不开心-丧失动力的泥坑中原地踏步。找到自己应该做的事和想做的事，然后把应该做的事转化为想做的事。
docs.title: Xin staff
